webLinks.linkText: TfNSW interactive road closure & clearway map - Sun Run 2021

properties.headline: Sun Run - Saturday 6 February - DEE WHY, CURL CURL, FRESHWATER, QUEENSCLIFF, MANLY The Strand, Griffin Road, North Steyne & South Steyne
properties.publicTransport: Some buses will divert while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sun Run 2021 Road Closures and Clearways
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sun Run 2021 Road Closures and Clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual 10km Sun Run will start at 6:15am from The Strand in Dee Why and finish by 11am at South Steyne in Manly. Road closures, parking restrictions and changed traffic conditions will be in effect.

Road closures:

  • Dee Why - 3.30am to 9am: sections of Howard Ave, The Strand and Dee Why Pde. Crossover maintained on Oaks Ave at The Strand eastbound until 5:15am and westbound until 6am. 
  • Curl Curl to Freshwater - 5:30am to 9am: Griffin Rd, Pitt Rd, Abbott Rd, Carrington Pde and local surrounding roads will be closed. Crossover maintained on Griffin Rd at Pacific Pde in both directions and on Playfair Rd at Pitt Rd in both directions until 6am. 
  • Queenscliff - 5.30am to 10am: sections of Undercliff Rd, Dalley St, Greycliffe St, Queenscliff Rd, Dowling St, Lumsdaine Dr and surrounding local roads. Crossover maintained westbound (exit only) on Crowd Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St from 5:30am-6:15am and 9am-10am. 
  • Manly - 3.30am to 9:30am: sections of North Steyne, Raglan St, Collingwood St and other local roads. Managed access for Cameron Ave residents from 5.30am-9am.
  • Manly - 3.30am to 11am: sections of South Steyne, Wentworth St, Ashburner St and Victoria Pde.

Affected residents are advised to travel before or after the roads are closed as managed access will be limited or restricted. 

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 3:30am until 9am on roads in Dee Why, North Curl Curl, Freshwater, Queenscliff and Manly including sections of Abbott Road, Howard Avenue, The Strand, Evans Street, Crown Road and North Steyne.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

DEE WHY / NORTH CURL CURL

From 3:30am to 9am

  • Abbott Rd between Pitt Rd and Harbord Rd both sides
  • Howard Ave between 94 Howard Ave and The Strand northern side
  • Howard Ave between The Strand and 103 Howard Ave southern side
  • The Strand between Dee Why Pde and Oaks Ave both sides  

FRESHWATER

From 3:30am to 9am  

  • Evans St between Charles St and no. 9 Evans St both sides  

QUEENSCLIFF

From 3:30am to 9am  

  • Crown Rd between Cavill St and Dowling St both sides  

MANLY

From 3:30am to 9am  

  • North Steyne between Collingwood Street and The Corso eastern side
  • North Steyne between The Corso and Raglan St western side
  • South Steyne between The Corso and Ashburner St eastern side
  • South Steyne between Victoria Pde and The Corso western side
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
Roads will be progressively reopened by Police and the TfNSW after cleaning and infrastructure removal.

DEE WHY

From 3:30am to 9am

  • Dee Why Pde 1 between Clyde Rd and The Strand  
  • Howard Ave between Clyde Rd and The Strand  
  • The Strand between Dee Why Pde and Oaks Ave    

Notes: 1 Local access to Dee Why Beach Car Park until full.  

From 5:15am to 9am

  • Oaks Ave 1 between Clyde Rd and The Strand (eastbound)  
  • The Strand between Oaks Ave and Griffin Rd (southbound)  

Notes: 1 Local access only until 6am. The Strand at Oaks Ave Eastbound crossover until 5:15am. Westbound crossover until 6am

From 5:30am to 9am

  • Boronia St between Monash Pde and Griffin Rd (westbound)
  • Griffin Rd between Pacific Pde and Headland Rd  
  • Monash Pde between Pacific Pde and Oaks Ave (northbound)
  • The Strand Between Pacific Pde and Griffin Rd  
  • The Strand Ln between Monash Pde and Griffin Rd    

Note. No vehicular access to roads between the course and the coast between 6am and 7:15am. Dee Why - Griffin Rd at Pacific Pde crossover in both directions until 6am

From 6am to 7:15am

  • Pacific Pde1 between Wheeler Pde and Griffin Rd (eastbound)
  • Pacific Pde1 between Monash Pde and Griffin Rd (westbound)  

Note: 1 Dee Why - Griffin Rd at Pacific Pde crossover in both directions until 6am

NORTH CURL CURL

From 5:30am to 9am

  • Abbott Rd between Harbord Rd and Griffin Rd  
  • Delaigh Ave 1 between Parr Ave and Pitt Rd (southbound)
  • Fairport St 1 between Makim St and Pitt Rd (southbound)
  • Fay St 1 between Makim St and Pitt Rd (southbound)
  • Griffin Rd between Headland Rd and Abbott Rd  
  • North Rd 1 between Bellevue Pde and Pitt Rd (southbound)
  • Parr Ave 1 between Headland Rd and Reid Ave (southbound)
  • Pitt Rd between Griffin Rd and Abbott Rd  
  • Playfair Rd 1 between Parr Ave and Pitt Rd (southbound)
  • Rabaul Rd 1 between Fay St and Pitt Rd (eastbound)
  • Reid Ave 1 between Bellevue Pde and Pitt Rd (southbound)              

Note: 1 Local access maintained. North Curl Curl - Pitt Rd at Playfair Rd cross over in both directions until 6am via Playfair Rd, Ross St and Pitt Rd.

NORTH CURL CURL

From 6am to 7:30am

  • Headland Rd 1 between Wheeler Pde and Griffin Rd    

Note:

CURL CURL

From 5:30am to 9am

  • Adams St between Lalchere St and Griffin Rd (eastbound)
  • Beach St between Ellen St and Carrington Pde  
  • Carrington Pde from Adams St to Freshwater boundary  
  • Ellen St from Beach St  
  • Gardere Ave between Farnell St and Carrington Pde (eastbound)
  • Griffin Rd between Abbott Rd and Adams St    

FRESHWATER

From 5:30am to 9am

  • Carrington Pde between Curl Curl boundary and Lumsdaine Dr  
  • Charles St1 between Evans St and Undercliff Rd (westbound)
  • Charles St between Undercliff Rd and Moore Rd (eastbound)
  • Charles St between Ocean View Rd and Evans St (eastbound)
  • Evans St between Carrington Pde and Albert St  
  • Gore St between Kooloora Ave and Moore Rd  
  • Kooloora Ave between Gore St and Freshwater Beach Carpark  
  • Kooloora Ave between Charles St and Gore St (eastbound)
  • Moore Rd between Gore St and Charles St  
  • Ocean View Rd between Charles St and Freshwater Beach Carpark    

Note: 1 Local access maintained to Charles St westbound between Kooloora Ave and Moore Rd. Note No vehicular access to roads between the course and the coast between 5:30am and 9am.

From 5:30am to 10am   

  • Evans St between Lumsdaine Dr and Carrington Pde  
  • Lumsdaine Dr between Carrington Pde and Evans St  
  • Undercliff Rd between Charles St and Dowling St    

QUEENSCLIFF

From 5:30am to 10am

  • Bridge Rd between Greycliffe St and Stuart Somerville Bridge  
  • Cavill St between Crown Rd and Dalley St  
  • Cavill St between Oliver Rd and Crown Rd (southbound)
  • Crown Rd1 between Dowling St and Cavill St  
  • Dalley St between Cavill St and Queenscliff Rd  
  • Dalley St between Oliver St and Cavill St (eastbound)
  • Dowling St between Undercliff Rd and Crown Rd  
  • Dowling St between Lawrence St and Undercliff Rd (southbound)
  • Greycliffe St between Queenscliff Rd and Bridge Rd  
  • Queenscliff Rd between Dalley St and Greycliffe St  
  • Queenscliff Rd between Greycliffe St and Pavilion St (westbound)
  • Queenscliff Rd south of Dalley St to end of road    

Note: 1 Managed vehicle crossover point westbound before 6:15am and after 9am. Queenscliff - Crown Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St crossover - Managed exit westbound only from 5:30am - 6:15am and 9am – 10am. No exit from 6:15am – 9am.   

MANLY

From 3:30am to 9:30am

  • Collingwood St1 between Bonner Ave and North Steyne (eastbound)
  • Denison St1 between Whistler St and North Steyne  
  • North Steyne between Cameron Ave and Raglan St (southbound)
  • North Steyne between Raglan St and Collingwood St (northbound)
  • Raglan St between Henrietta Ln and North Steyne  
  • Raglan St between Whistler St and Henrietta Ln (eastbound)  

Note: 1 Managed residential access. Residents in Manly on Cameron Ave - Managed access to/from Cameron Ave via Collingwood St only between 5:30am and 9:30am

From 3:30am to 11am

  • Ashburner St1 between South Steyne and Darley Rd  
  • North Steyne between Raglan St and The Corso  
  • Rialto Ln2 at Wentworth St  
  • South Steyne between The Corso and Victoria Pde  
  • South Steyne3 between Victoria Pde and Ashburner St  
  • Victoria Pde2 between Darley Rd and South Steyne (eastbound)
  • Wentworth St between Rialto Ln and South Steyne  
  • Wentworth St 2 between Darley Rd and Rialto Ln (eastbound)  

Notes

1 Managed residential access via Victoria Pde and South Steyne

2 Managed residential access

3 Access for Ashburner St residents only. No parking on South Steyne due to Special Event Clearways

properties.headline: A-League - Monday 3 February - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Melbourne City from 7:05pm to approx 9pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the event.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the game and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 6 February - LEUMEAH Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive approaching Campbelltown Sports Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Macarthur FC v Western Sydney Wanderers from 7:10pm to approx 9pm at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr, Leumeah Rd, Airds Rd, Plough Inn Rd and Campbelltown Rd as soccer fans travel to the game.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads between the station and stadium.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.headline: Triathlon - Saturday 6 February - TOMAKIN George Bass Drive, North Head Drive
properties.otherAdvice:
The Batemans Bay Triathlon Festival is taking place in Tomakin on Saturday 6 February.

Road closures will be in place from 8:30am until 1:30pm approx. on the following roads: 

  • George Bass Dr between Broulee Rd and North Head Dr 
  • North Head Dr between George Bass Dr and Princes Hwy

Controlled access will also be in place on George Bass Dr between Sunpatch Pde, Tomakin and Train Street, Broulee, as well as between Train St and Broulee Rd.

Motorists should exercise caution while travelling in the area as participants are running and cycling on roads. Residential access will be maintained during the closure period.

roads.mainStreet: George Bass Drive, North Head Drive

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 7 February - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Western United from 6pm to approx 8pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the event.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the game from 4pm and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 7 February - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Newcastle Jets v Melbourne City at McDonald Jones Stadium from 4:05pm until 6pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: A-League - Monday 8 February - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Wellington Phoenix at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium from 7:10pm until 9pm approx. W-League game from 4:30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual during weeknight evening peak in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close before the game including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.headline: Cricket Final - Saturday 6 February - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park walking & transport route map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park walking & transport route map

properties.otherAdvice:
BBL Final: Sydney Sixers v TBC at the SCG from 7:40pm. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as cricket fans travel to and from the SCG on Saturday evening. 

Driver Ave is partially closed outside the stadium before the match and will reopen when play has finished and crowds have cleared.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around Moore Park from 3pm until midnight on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

FROM 3PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street between City Road and South Dowling Street
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 31 January - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Wellington Phoenix from 4pm to approx 6pm. 

*Note: Donnison St is also now closed at Showground Rd.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the event.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St from 3pm and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.
